meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: This order may be cited as the Bankruptcy (Fees and Percentages) Order.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.content: In this order, unless the context otherwise requires, a section referred to by number means the section so numbered in the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) and a rule referred to by number means the rule so numbered in the Bankruptcy Rules (Cap. 6 sub. leg. A).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Fees and percentages
section.content: The fees and percentages to be charged for proceedings in bankruptcy shall be those set out in the Schedule and shall be taken in the office of the Official Receiver or in the Registry of the High Court as the case may require.

subsection.content: This paragraph relates to the fee payable under paragraph 9 of Table B of the Schedule.

Where in respect of any estate the Official Receiver has accounted to the court under section 78(3) or a trustee’s account has been sent to the Official Receiver under section 93(1) before the commencement date but the fee payable in respect thereof has not been paid before that date, the fee calculated under the old scale shall continue to be payable except that where such fee together with all fees paid in respect of previous accounts is higher than the fee that would be payable if calculated under the new scale on the aggregate amount of assets realized and brought to credit, a fee calculated under the new scale on the aggregate amount of assets realized and brought to credit (giving credit for any amount previously paid) shall be payable.

In the case a bankruptcy commenced before the commencement date continues after that date, the fee payable in respect of an account sent to the Official Receiver under section 93(1) or, where the Official Receiver acts as trustee, prepared for the purposes of section 78(3), shall be calculated under the new scale in respect of the aggregate amount of assets realized and brought to credit and in respect of any assets realized and brought to credit before the commencement date in respect of which a fee has been paid, credit shall be given as if a fee calculated under the new scale had been paid.

Where an account relating to a period ending before the commencement date is sent to the Official Receiver under section 93(1) or, where the Official Receiver acts as trustee, is prepared for the purposes of section 78(3), after the commencement date, the fee payable in respect thereof shall be calculated under the new scale.

subsection.def: commencement date (生效日期) means the date of the coming into operation of the Bankruptcy (Fees and Percentages) (Amendment) Order 1987 (L.N. 195 of 1987);
new scale (新收費表) means the scale of fees prescribed in paragraph 9 of Table B of the Schedule as substituted by the Bankruptcy (Fees and Percentages) (Amendment) Order 1987 (L.N. 195 of 1987);
old scale (舊收費表) means the scale of fees* prescribed in paragraph 9 of Table B of the Schedule in force immediately before the commencement date.

editorialNote.content: * For old scale of fees, see L.N. 144 of 1985.

schedule.name: sch0

tr.td: Bankruptcy petition

td.p: This fee includes any fee on answering a petition or setting down for hearing. (L.N. 127 of 2007)

tr.td: Proof of debt above $250, including filing, (other than a proof for workmen’s wages) (L.N. 567 of 1994; L.N. 164 of 1997; L.N. 171 of 2013)
Petition under section 112

td.p: This fee includes any fee on answering a petition or setting down for hearing. (L.N. 127 of 2007)

tr.td:
Application for early discharge, for the suspension of discharge or for the lifting of a suspension of discharge including any publication
costs (L.N. 83 of 1998; 22 of 2023 s. 54)
and for each creditor notified (L.N. 164 of 1997; L.N. 171 of 2013)
Application under section 30AB for a non-commencement order (1 of 2016 s. 15)
Search in the High Court Registry (other than by a petitioner, trustee, bankrupt or any officer of the court) for a document or file referred to or required (25 of 1998 s. 2)
On an inspection of a copy of the trustee's accounts filed under section 93(4), (4AA) or (4A) (22 of 2023 ss. 14 & 88)
Office copy of a document, per page or part thereof
Allocatur by the Registrar for any costs, charges or disbursements, for every $100 allowed or part thereof
Application to the Official Receiver for payment of money out of the Bankruptcy Estates Account (L.N. 567 of 1994; L.N. 164 of 1997; L.N. 171 of 2013)

td.p: On every payment of money out of the Bankruptcy Estates Account—
on each $1,000 or fraction of $1,000 to be charged as follows—

tr.td: where the money consists of unclaimed dividends, on each dividend paid out
where the money consists of undistributed funds or balances, on the amount paid out

td.p: The total fees taken under item 11(a)(ii) shall not exceed $37,500 in each bankruptcy. (L.N. 164 of 1997; L.N. 171 of 2013)
On an application to the court for an interim order under section 20, a fee computed at the following rates on the gross amount of the proposal—

tr.td: on every $1,000 or fraction of $1,000 up to $100,000
on every $1,000 or fraction of $1,000 beyond $100,000

td.p: Provided that where a fee has been taken on a previous application to the court for an interim order under section 20, or where a fee has been paid under item 9 of Table B, seven-eighths of the amount thereof shall be deducted from the fee payable.

For the purpose of calculating this fee, the gross amount means the amount to be provided under the terms of the proposal for ordinary and preferential creditors, and for costs, charges and expenses, and for fees and percentages (other than this fee). (L.N. 83 of 1998)
On an application for release by a trustee—

tr.td: for every $1,000 or fraction of $1,000 of the gross amount of assets realized and brought to credit

td.p: Registration of assignment of book debts under rule 127—

tr.td: on producing original assignment, filing attested copy thereof and certified translation (when necessary) in the English or Chinese language, including registering and marking original (L.N. 83 of 1998)
every search or official certificate of the result of a search in one name in any register or index in the custody of the Registrar
for every additional name if included in the same certificate
for a duplicate copy of a certificate, per page or part thereof

Application by a member of the public to the Official Receiver for a search on whether a bankruptcy petition has been presented against a person or firm (L.N. 223 of 1989; L.N. 567 of 1994; L.N. 164 of 1997; L.N. 171 of 2013)
Application by a member of the public to the Official Receiver for issue of a non-bankruptcy certificate for a person (L.N. 567 of 1994; L.N. 164 of 1997; L.N. 171 of 2013)
For the publication of a notice relating to bankruptcy (L.N. 223 of 1989; L.N. 567 of 1994; L.N. 164 of 1997; L.N. 171 of 2013; 22 of 2023 s. 54)
Examination by a creditor of the record signed by the bankrupt under section 19 (L.N. 83 of 1998)
Examination by a creditor of the proofs of debt of other creditors under rule 7 of the Proof of Debts Rules (Cap. 6 sub. leg. E) (L.N. 83 of 1998)
Photocopying charge per page or part thereof for providing a creditor with a list of creditors under section 87 (L.N. 83 of 1998; L.N. 127 of 2007)

section.name: s1
section.content: On payments made by the Official Receiver into any bank account opened by him in his capacity as nominee under a voluntary arrangement, after deducting any sums paid to secured creditors in respect of their securities, and not being monies received and spent in carrying on the business of a debtor, a charge of 10%. (L.N. 427 of 1993; L.N. 83 of 1998; L.N. 127 of 2007; L.N. 171 of 2013)

section.name: s1A
section.content: For the Official Receiver acting as interim trustee, or trustee to administer a debtor’s or bankrupt’s property, on every payment made into the Official Receiver in Bankruptcy Account . $170The payment referred to in this paragraph does not include any of the following—(a)sums that are payable to secured creditors in respect of their securities;(b)money received in carrying on the business of the debtor or bankrupt. (L.N. 171 of 2013)

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: On the amount distributed to creditors by the Official Receiver when acting as nominee under a voluntary arrangement, a fee of 5%.

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: For the work done by the Official Receiver in connection with an approved voluntary arrangement to which the Official Receiver was not appointed to act as nominee by the creditors at the meeting, a fee of such amount as the appointed nominee and the Official Receiver may agree or as the court may approve. (L.N. 83 of 1998)

section.name: s3
section.content: On the amount paid to preferential creditors or distributed in dividend or otherwise by the Official Receiver when acting otherwise than as nominee under an approved voluntary arrangement, a charge of 5%. (L.N. 83 of 1998)

section.name: s4
section.content: For the Official Receiver acting as interim trustee of the property of a debtor under section 13, in addition to the percentage chargeable on realizations, on every order . $1,000
and in addition, where the order is in force for a longer period than 14 days, for every 7 days after the first 14, and for every fraction of 7 days . $1,000

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: For all official stationery, printing and postage within Hong Kong; and to include notices to creditors of meetings and sittings of the court and room hire—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: for a number of creditors and bankrupts not exceeding 10 . $620

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: thereafter for every 10 additional creditors and bankrupts or part thereof . $620

section.continued: This fee does not include the charge which may be made by the Official Receiver on calling a meeting at the request of creditors, for which provision is made in paragraph 6. (L.N. 223 of 1989; L.N. 427 of 1993; L.N. 567 of 1994; L.N. 164 of 1997; L.N. 83 of 1998; L.N. 171 of 2013)

section.name: s6
section.content: Where the Official Receiver calls a meeting at the request of the creditors, the costs of summoning the meeting, which shall be deemed to include all disbursements for stationery, printing and postage within Hong Kong shall be $1,440. Any charge for hiring a room outside the Official Receiver’s Office by reason of the large number of creditors shall be additional to the said sum. (L.N. 427 of 1993; L.N. 567 of 1994; L.N. 164 of 1997; L.N. 171 of 2013)

section.name: s7
section.content: For the Official Receiver supervising a special manager or the carrying on of a bankrupt’s business—
such amount as the court, on application of the Official Receiver, may consider reasonable. (L.N. 223 of 1989; L.N. 83 of 1998)

section.name: s8
section.content: Travelling, keeping possession and other reasonable expenses of Official Receiver—the amount disbursed.

section.name: s9
section.leadIn: On the aggregate amount of the assets realized and brought to credit there shall be paid—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: in respect of estates in which the Official Receiver acts as trustee, when he accounts to the court under section 86B(2);

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: in respect of estates in which the Official Receiver is not acting as trustee, when the trustee provides his accounts to the Official Receiver under section 93(1A),

section.continued: a fee according to the following scale—

subsection.name: i
subsection.content: on the first $500,000 or fraction thereof, $100 on every $1,000 or fraction thereof;

subsection.name: ii
subsection.content: on the next $500,000 or fraction thereof, $75 on every $1,000 or fraction thereof;

subsection.name: iii
subsection.content: on the next $4,000,000 or fraction thereof, $65 on every $1,000 or fraction thereof;

subsection.name: iv
v
subsection.content: on the next $40,000,000 or fraction thereof, $20 on every $1,000 or fraction thereof;

subsection.name: vi
subsection.content: on all further amounts, $10 on every $1,000 or fraction thereof. (L.N. 83 of 1998; L.N. 127 of 2007)

section.name: s10
section.content: Where the Official Receiver performs any special duties not provided for under the other paragraphs of this Table—such amount as the court, on the application of the Official Receiver, may consider reasonable.

section.name: s11
section.content: Notwithstanding the fees and charges prescribed in the foregoing paragraphs but subject to the availability of funds, where the Official Receiver acts as trustee to administer a bankrupt’s property, the total fees and charges under this Table shall not be less than $11,250. (L.N. 164 of 1997; L.N. 83 of 1998; L.N. 171 of 2013)

tr.td: For inventory, valuation, sales by auction or private treaty of assets

td.p: Such an amount as the Creditors’ Committee or the Registrar approves.

tr.td: For valuation of leasehold property, and reporting thereon

td.p: Such an amount as the Creditors’ Committee or the Registrar approves.

tr.td: Cost of surveys, dilapidations and specifications

td.p: Such an amount as the Registrar approves.
The foregoing charges to be in addition to such out-of-pocket expenses as may be authorized at the time by the Official Receiver or trustee.

schedule.text: An architect or auctioneer who uses his own motor car or motor cycle, instead of travelling by railway or hired vehicles, shall be entitled if the taxing officer is satisfied that such user was reasonable to an allowance not exceeding $1.00 per kilometre.

editorialNote.content: The Schedule was amended by the Bankruptcy (Fees and Percentages)(Amendment) Order 2007 (L.N. 127 of 2007). The transitional and savings provisions contained in s. 3 of that Amendment Order are reproduced as follows:

level.content: Notwithstanding anything contained in this Order, the amendments effected under this Order shall not apply to any case in which the bankruptcy petition was presented before the commencement date, and such case shall continue and be disposed of as if this Order had not been made.
This section is in addition to and not in derogation of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

For the purpose of this section, *commencement date (生效日期) means the day appointed for the commencement of the Bankruptcy (Amendment) Ordinance 2005 (18 of 2005) (except sections 1, 12, 19 and 32 of that Ordinance).”.
